org.jlab.coda.emu.support.data

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.emu.support.data.Statistics

  • public final class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps some statistics on time to build an event.
    Author:
    timmer (10/24/14)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(int window)
        Constructor. As new values are added to data and their total number exceeds "window", old points are deleted. Use 40 histogram bins. Size of each bin is determined automatically by dividing the range ( (5*mean) minus the number rounded to nearest 100 which is less than the min data point) by the number of bins.
        Parameters:
        window - max number of data points to hold at once.

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(int window,
                  int binCount)
        Constructor. As new values are added to data and their total number exceeds "window", old points are deleted. Size of each bin is determined automatically by dividing the range ( (5*mean) minus the number rounded to nearest 100 which is less than the min data point) by the number of bins.
        Parameters:
        window - max number of data points to hold at once.
        binCount - number of histogram bins.

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(int window,
                  int binCount,
                  int binSize)
        Constructor. As new values are added to data and their total number exceeds "window", old points are deleted.
        Parameters:
        window - max number of data points to hold at once.
        binCount - number of histogram bins.
        binSize - size of each histogram bin.

    • Method Detail

      • getHistogram

        public int[] getHistogram()
        Method to get the histogram array of ints. It contains metadata before the actual data:

        1. The 1st element contains the bin size.

        2. The 2nd element contains the first bin's starting value

        3. The 3rd element contains the data's mean value

        4. The 4rd element contains the data's minimum value

        5. The 5rd element contains the data's maximum value

        The rest of the array contains the histogram itself.
        Returns:
        histogram

      • addValue

        public void addValue(int val)
        Method to add data point.
        Parameters:
        val - data to add

      • fillHistogram

        public int[] fillHistogram()
        Fill the histogram integer array with data points. Only data points with a value < 5*mean are used.
        Returns:
        histogram just filled

      • printBuildTimeHistogram

        public void printBuildTimeHistogram(java.lang.String label,
                                    java.lang.String units)
        Print out a histogram of data points. Only data points of value < 5*mean are used.
        Parameters:
        label - header string to print.
        units - unit string to print.
